Package com.sharetea.backend.Repositories

Interface UsersRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Users,Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Users,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Users,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Users,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Users,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Users>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Users,Integer>
@Repository public interface UsersRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Users,Integer>

  • Method Details

    • findByEmail

      Users findByEmail(String email)
      Finds a user in the database given their email
      Parameters:
      email - Email to identify user
      Returns:
      Users object that matches email

    • addOrderCount

      @Modifying @Query(value="update users set order_count = order_count + 1 where user_id = ?1 ", nativeQuery=true) void addOrderCount(Integer userID)
      When making an order, adds 1 to user's order count
      Parameters:
      userID - ID to identify user

    • getUsers

      @Query(value="select user_id, first_name, last_name, email, phone_number as phone, ssn as \"SSN\", position as role, phone_number as phone, address, picture from users where email != \'\' and user_id != 27 and email != \'\' order by user_id", nativeQuery=true) List<Map<String,Object>> getUsers()
      Gets users' information
      Returns:
      JSON Object with database user details

    • getUserInfo

      @Query(value="select first_name || \' \' || last_name AS name, email, picture from users where email = ?1", nativeQuery=true) Map<String,Object> getUserInfo(String email)
      Single user information to display on navbar on website
      Parameters:
      email - Email to identify user
      Returns:
      JSON Object with current user information

    • deleteUserOrder

      @Modifying @Query(value="update orders set customer_id = 27 where customer_id = ?1", nativeQuery=true) void deleteUserOrder(Integer customerID)
      Changes user's order to deleted user when wanting to delete user
      Parameters:
      customerID - ID to identify user
